content: A lot to learn, but enjoying the process. Integration with DJI Gimbal would be very useful.
I have the s21 ultra and 10 bit color isn't available. I have the GPU off, 4k resolution set and still there is no switch for 8 or 10 bit. I don't want to get a refund, but I need 10 bit.

Very cool and powerful app. The only thing missing is gimbal support for DJI products and maybe 8k recording for newer Samsung devices... and thanks for the 48 fps mode and power of 24 shutter speeds!

I had to delete this App.. I have OnePlus 8 Pro... The App Frozen.. Why Am I Not Able To Use All My Lens? Seems To Have Amazing Features... Possibly Compete with FilMic Pro.. I Hope You Can Fix These Problems
I can't retrieve the folder or move it from the app. I was using this app for a job and lost a day of footage along with 60gigs of memory.

Make sure to try it first before buying. Because different phone have different feature that worked properly. Gamma curve selection is many. But not all is good for your camera sensor. Gamut selection other than Rec.709 is bad because it converted from Rec.601 color primaries original. Audio bitrate is many. But it is useless because audio frequency is limited to 17 KHz. Better stick to 160 Kbps. Manual wb adjustment is bad. Sometimes I can't get target 6500K when using wb card.
Hi app is great but i cannot find my files in my phone. I can playback through the app. Please help

It is a wonderful app that actually has much more features than the flagship app in the market. The app changed how I shoot videos and results in great quality. I just wish that it supports DJI Om 4 Gimbal as sometimes it is not convenient to use the gimbal and control the app from the touch screen of the smartphone. I already started using McPro24fps as my go to video app. I'll wait for the gimbal support and hopefully it will be supported soon. there is no need to have a full gimbal features support, just the basics, shutter button, pan and tilt would be enough.
Amazing
This app is truly amazing for mobile film making. It has tons of good features (accurate wb, color profiles, lut,etc.). I wish though that this app would have a support for gimbals.

I have produced and filmed with many cameras such as Panavision, Arriflex, Hasselblad, Nikon, Canon and many more with credits such as Microsoft, abc, MTV, Epson and lots of international projects. mcpro24fps Is a professional grade app with features which only a professional film maker could develop. Now if this team could crack open the note20 ultra 108 megapixel camera plus build a still camera app, I personally would pay $100 for the upgrade. Bravo

My God, this is what I've been waiting for. Exceptional program. Is it is easy to use? Hell no, and that's the point of it. There's a learning curve and if you truly wanna be a pro you must learn what all these do and take advantage of them for truly professional work. You can set bitrate, fps, intra frame mp4, luts. It's amazing this Russian programmer has nailed this feature set. It's brought my old Samsung back to life. Get any new Android phone with multiple lenses on board and shine.
With the new update it works fine on pixel 4a.. changing rating to 5 stars..awesome app

Since the update none of my videos show up in my gallery app outside of the mcpro24fps app Also I wish there was an aption to undo settings back to the original for when you mess with gamuts and different logs. Update is amazing though. Can't wait to see more exciting stuff
replyContent:
Do you have opportunity to join us in Telegram chat? https://t.me/mcpro24fps_en
We can help. +)

content: Simply the BEST and most function loaded professional filming app today. Packed with detailed settings and LOGs, fully ready for a professional gig or just a hobby. The competition (F*****) stays behind, but is totally cool too. Two solid apps.
Omg!!! This is a mind blowing update!!! Wow!! üòÉüëåüëåüëèüëè
Works well on a Galaxy Note20U Snapdragon: h265 10bit full frame at 24fps, at 190mbps with constant framerate and noise reduction. Not working at all on a Pixel 5: no preview...

This app is incredible! Skip the GPU and get 10bit footage! Crazy selection of tonemap curves. Actually has ACES as well. I wish I could shoot ACES with 10 bit, hopefully in a future update. Crushes all other video apps if you are looking to get true control over the output.
Brilliant smartphone filmmakers app
On my Note8 I can get 240mbps, and the mlog100 is the best flat profile I've seen to date! Amazingly cinimatic video- even from my old phone
Hey guys! Excellent app to capture videos! Astounding work. Any plans on bringing the 10 bit video to OnePlus 8 Pro? I use that phone ü•∫ Hey guys I've uninstalled the app and would like a refund.

Great quality on samsung galaxy s8 plus. I wish the shutter speed would stay the same when i use auto. I would like to just have auto ISO and the shutter speed stay the same. If there is a way to fix this, then the app gets 5 stars. Also i hope to see they add higher framerates! Update: November 18 2020 I really dont like this app anymore. Just took it off my tripod for vlogging and the stablization is horrible. I have a samsung galaxy s8 plus and theres no option for stabilization either.
Amazing
Experia XZ1: Impressive results. A lot of options to work with. Recommended.
LG V50 ThinQ rocks in the top! 4k60fps HDR10!!! That's snapdragon 855!

This is a huge game changer for Mobile filmmakers, I was thinking of getting an iPhone until I saw the capabilities of this app. It's very amazing, the footage looks great when I grade it, in terms of details, and quality, its something what most filmmakers needed. Is there like an open forum for discussion to see how far the camera can go? And like what kind of support we get on all smartphones tested, experiments to do. We need to get more people try out this app.

There are plenty of features and options to make your footage look great. I'm using the S20 Ultra and it only works up to 30fps. Any time I try to go higher, it will say Camera Lost and have to restart the app. Would give it a higher rating if the 60fps actually worked.
Excellent app for filming with advanced options

Great app, on my xperia xz2 compact works wonderfully and does what others could not do. On my galaxy j7 2016 with res 1920x1080 and up the video looks squished. Not a big deal since the J7 is a backup phone, would be nice to have it working on it though.
Please add background recording feature. When quit the app before flush recording buffer, app blacked out when re-open the app. Othrr than that, it's amazing app. Worth the price.
I really love this application so much it allows me to do a lot with my smart phone but I really like to bring out the option of time lapse mode and 60fps
I could not use it. It makes my phone freeze up
It doesn't work in my p30 lite what should I do now?
Will this app desqueeze anamorphic footage and save it or do you still have to desqueeze it in post?
replyContent: Hi. Only through GPU. Without GPU only in post-processing. Or 10 bit and post, or 8 bit and on fly.

content: Wow. Just, wow. Started playing with it after purchasing today, and it already wipes the floor with Filmic Pro. So many options and features, at a fraction of the cost, but there is a learning curve! And the output is superior. So glad we Android users finally have GOOD options. (Note 20 Ultra)
This is the best video recorder app for mobile phones ever. But one thing is so missing: pause while recording. When? :))

I really did not expect to find an app that can do FHD 60p CFR (constant framer rate) on my HTC U11+ smartphone. The app have a lot of interesting options like 10bit color depth and logs that I will definitely use with new mobile. Thanks a lot, mate! UI is OK in general (a bit overcomplicated). Some UI elements are confusing and I hope this will be addressed in future. P.S It would be nice if EN demo version available (allow to record up to 3 seconds for example).
Best App For Android To Push Mobile Phone Camera System. Great app for real pro who whants use Samsung S20 Ultra (One UI 2.5)
Worst camera app. Please could I get a refund, its terrible. Thank you.
Excellent. Allows for disabling of OIS

Exceptional app, works flawlessly with Xiaomi Mi Note 10, thanks for developers! Would hope for 10bit video recording, is this possible? Also, there is one thing that keeps me for switching to Filmic Pro - in Filmic Pro you can change framerate settings with exposure for example 1/10 or even 1/3s. Yes it gives lower framerate, but very useful for artistic interpretations or filming in low light. Would love to see this implementation in mcpro24fps in the future!
This is the best app for video capture. End of story

Wow_ This Is What Andriod Need ,Its Great App I Ever Use,But Im Using LG v30 And There Is No Option For 10 Bit Recoding, As Far iknow Lg V30 Camers And Hardware Is Capbale Of 10Bit Recoding ,So Can You Gyz Adding 10Bit Recoding For Lg V30? Any Plan?
replyContent: Thanks for review. On LG V30 10 bits not possible, manufacturer restricted access.

content: Pretty good app..but heating up my mobile phone oppo reno4 pro and video has a lot of motion blurring by itself ..pls fix it..it will one of best apps in the world
replyContent: Thanks for review. App can not add some moution blur, it is device characteristic or selected exposure result.

content: Fantastic App that made me replace Filmic pro on my mi note 10. I just want clearer instructions regarding focus points.
120 fps not work on s9+
replyContent: Thanks for review. Such modes may have limitations.  For example, work only in automatic exposure mode, do not like noisy log profiles.

content: Amazing alternative to FiLMiC Pro, so far so good. I was almost going to buy the iPhone SE2 as I couldn't find anything usable for Android. Then I saw mcpro24fps vs FiLMiC comparison video in YouTube. Downloaded it and tried, works as good, if not better than FiLMiC. Thank you and keep up the great work! BTW, I'm using Sony XZ2 Premium.
As an Android user, this app is unbelievable. I've completely stopped using filmic Pro. The features are endless. Finally, a real cinematic Masterpiece for Android users.

I can't seem to do any color correction with the presets like, mLog, msLog etc. I have the app running on a Huawei mate 20 pro. Am I doing something wrong? I click on PICTURE and select a Tonemap, but nothing happens.
replyContent:
It looks like your device, with the declared support for the tonemap curve, still does not support it. Huawei P30/Pro/P40 have same problem.
Your choice: Auto tonemap curve and GPU Log with reverse tonemapping.

content: Really amazing app that does even more than Filmic Pro and some features I didn't think possible. Only major flaw is the lack of exposure options. By default auto should leave shutter at 180deg and control auto exposure with ISO and only change shutter slower if max ISO is reached or faster if min ISO is reached. Great to have manual and auto but auto should be more intelligent (not increase shutter speed and ISO like it does) and also be able to lock shutter and use auto ISO only.
replyContent:
Thanks for review.
More intelligent autoexposure is not possible on smartphone. Smartphone have not shutter priority mode. Auto is auto at the discretion of device.

content: Is it possible to get clean HDMI and without letterbox? Edit after your comment: 1. Hide the GUI from the preview screen like Filmic = clean HDMI; 2. Enlarge the preview to the whole screen when GUI is hidden (no black spaces from right and left) = no letterboxed hdmi output. No one has this currently.
replyContent: This is definitely not possible at the moment. I don‚Äôt even guess how this can be done, because the receiving device shows the entire screen. It seems to me that this should be the configuration of the receiving device.

content: 10-bit log, All-i & constant FPS recording are game changers in my opinion and not even the popular iPhone+filmic pro combo can match that. For the first time in 3 years I'm considering upgrading to a more powerful phone only to use this app! My LG V20, although perfectly fine for daily use, chokes when using this and gives overheating warning...but I'm surprised that it even works with such old hardware. This level of flexibility and nerdy features is what Android is all about! Thanks a lot.
Why is it that I cant use this for 60fps on my Poco F2 Pro? My phone is capable of 4k at 60fps
replyContent: Sorry, we have not any test-user with Poco F2 now. But we will try to activate 60fps by the method of scientific poking.

content: Astonishing. If you are into content creating / film making, this app is a must !! Filmic pro use to be the go to but lacked some features. This here is second to none and is worth every penny ! If you want to squeeze your device to get the very best video from it, here's the app. The devs are awesome to deal with and very responsive. You should be proud of yourselves, well done
On my Xiamo Mi 10 Notebook, The app appeared to have several functions missing. Is. Bit rate. Histogram, Individual control over speed, I so, and so on. Returned for refund.
replyContent: Notebook? It looks like You have trouble understanding the purpose of the app. On Xiaomi Mi 10 and Xiaomi Note 10 the app working very well.

content: Is support for slow motion footage at 120fps and 240fps coming?
replyContent:
Hi! Given that the high-speed shooting mode is very different from those that are now, at the moment we can not introduce these modes. But of course there are plans.
We are currently working on the picture and controls.

content: Filmic Pro alternative and more. Keep up the good work!
The best camera app on the market!
The only app that let me shoot video at 24,25,30 fps, in HLOG on my old Xperia XZ Premium. 4k @ 30fps @ 100mbps @ h264 looks fantastic and smooth
Manual controls with bitrate and log color profiles is amazing. The only thing is I wish it supported more shooting resolutions and frame rates like 1080p60 or 720p120 etc on xz premium
replyContent: 1080@60 on XZ Premium is Camera API (HAL1) functionality. Unfortunately, mcpro24fps supports only camera2 api. We have not tried working with fps above 60.

content: Amazing app this thing is astonishing and way better than the filmic pro app on my Xperia 1. The phone does tend to hot so if it does crash it's not the app but the phone heat. Overall very happy with the quality and high bit rate including 10 bit colour.

Excellent GUI, lots of manual controls, adjust bitrate up to 500mbps if your hardware supports it. That's crazy. No other video camera app can past 100mbps. I'm a owner of a Huawei P30 Pro and OnePlus 7 Pro and this app works well with those two phones.
replyContent: Thanks for a review. Stay with us.

content: Lots of settings, works great. Best camera on Android
Does the job. Slightly confusing control panel.
replyContent: Matter of habit.  Good ideas will come true.
